page.title: 09DICKER DAY-THE CARNIVAL
page.content: Being a pupil at St. Bede's School, I was invited to participate in Â£Dicker Day'. In fact this annual event takes place in our school grounds every three years. The date was Saturday July the 6th 1985 and many Dicker folks and townspeople came to enjoy a fun day out in the country. The proceeds of the carnival were devoted to guide dogs for the blind and local charities. The festival started off with a grand procession at 1.45 pm. The carnival was declared open by the Dicker King and Queen. There were competitions like dog shows, tug of war, archery, childrens sports and side shows. At 4 pm the draw was made for the grand lottery for which there were prizes. Admission fee was adults 20p, children 10p and parking free.
